clinical_study.brief_title: The Epigenetics of Exercise and Physical Activity in COPD
clinical_study.official_title: The Epigenetics of Exercise and Physical Activity in COPD

brief_summary.textblock: This study seeks to examine genome-wide DNA methylation patterns associated with physical activity and exercise capacity from peripheral blood collected from patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) before and after participation in a structured 9-week outpatient pulmonary rehabilitation program.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects who are referred to pulmonary rehabilitation IN THE COURSE OF THEIR USUAL CLINICAL CARE will be invited to participate in our observational study. Subjects who enroll in our study will undergo two in-person visits, once before initiating pulmonary rehabilitation classes and once at the conclusion of pulmonary rehabilitation classes. Participation in this study will not alter the course of their usual clinical care.

primary_outcome.description: Baseline patterns and changes over time after participation in exercise training

secondary_outcome.description: Change in exercise capacity (assessed as 6 minute walk distance) after exercise training in pulmonary rehabilitation

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in average daily step count
secondary_outcome.description: Change in pedometer assessed daily step count before and after exercise training in pulmonary rehabilitation

biospec_descr.textblock:
Peripheral blood and urine will be collected at 2 time points via venipuncture. Plasma and buffy coat will be extracted and stored for analysis at the conclusion of enrollment.
Participation in this study will not impact the course of usual clinical care and is thus meets the definition of an observational study.

study_pop.textblock: This study will recruit from Veterans referred to the VA Boston Pulmonary Rehabilitation Program who have a confirmed diagnosis of COPD.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age >40 years
- Diagnosis of COPD (defined as an FEV1/FVC<0.7 or evidence of emphysema on radiologist's read of a chest CT obtained in the course of patient's usual care)
- Referral to and participation in the VA Boston Pulmonary Rehabilitation program
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active or unstable cardiac disease
- Inability to ambulate > 1 block
- Recent acute exacerbation of COPD (defined as new or increased dose of systemic steroids and/or antibiotics for pulmonary indications)

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual level data will be entered into an approved research repository behind the VA firewall. Data will be shared with qualified researchers (see below)
